intro: Stenandrium mandioccanum var. emarginatum, commonly known as the margined stenandrium, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often palmately lobed, and the flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds.
